text: Law no. 22, to regulate the opening hours of shops on Sundays [Governor in council may make orders, applying to part or all of the Colony and to shops of any specified class, to limit to any extent or entirely probibit the opening of shops on Sunday and to provide for defined exemptions (sections 3—5). The Greek-Orthodox Sunday Observance Act, 2908, is repealed (section 9)]

text: May so Decree no. 6: Act to set up a central conciliation and Arbitration Board and municipal conciliation and arbitration boards [central Board of five members is permanent, with offices in the capital; municipal boards of three members are formed from time to time to deal with disputes in their respective areas. In addition to its work in connection with trade disputes, the Central Board keeps registers of industrial associations, chambers of commerce, etc., and approves rules of employment. It supervises the mursicipal minimum wage boards (chapter V). Proceedings before it are compulsory as a preliminary to a strike or lockout (chapter VI)]
full_text: May so Decree no. 6: Act to set up a central conciliation and Arbitration Board and municipal conciliation and arbitration boards [central Board of five members is permanent, with offices in the capital; municipal boards of three members are formed from time to time to deal with disputes in their respective areas. In addition to its work in connection with trade disputes, the Central Board keeps registers of industrial associations, chambers of commerce, etc., and approves rules of employment. It supervises the mursicipal minimum wage boards (chapter V). Proceedings before it are compulsory as a preliminary to a strike or lockout (chapter VI)].
